newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: INSURER SAYS CZECH FLOODS BIGGEST IN MODERN TIMES.
newsitem.headline: INSURER SAYS CZECH FLOODS BIGGEST IN MODERN TIMES.

text.p: The largest Czech insurer Ceska Pojistovna a.s. said on Tuesday that damage from floods which have hit eastern Czech Republic this week were the biggest catastrophe in the area in decades.
"It is clear today already that the the extent of damage does not have a comparison in the modern history of the Czech Republic," the company said in a statement.
Spokeswoman Marcela Doleckova said it was too early to give any more precise damage estimate.
Floods resulting from terrential rain have swept away houses, roads and railways in the region, and forced thousands out of their homes.
Pojistovna said that in just two out of about a dozen districts hit by the disaster over 10,000 buildings have been reported damaged.
"Ceska Pojistovna has several hundred thousand private clients, and several tens of thousands of business clients in the affected regions," the statement said.
Doleckova said that the company has secured enough liquidity to pay out advanced insurance payments.
